details: A showcase of classical and folk dances from across India, featuring Kuchipudi, Bharatanatyam, and Kathak performances. The festival celebrates the rich cultural diversity of Hyderabad, bringing together renowned dancers and artists from across the country.

A spectacular laser light and fountain show at Lumbini Park, set against the backdrop of Hussain Sagar Lake. The show narrates the history of Hyderabad using vibrant lights, water jets, and music, creating a mesmerizing experience for visitors.

event: Golconda Fort Sound and Light Show
details: A dramatic sound and light show at the historic Golconda Fort that recounts the rise and fall of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. With the majestic fort as the backdrop, the show immerses audiences in the history of the Deccan region.

A guided heritage walk around Charminar, exploring the historic sites, old markets, and architectural wonders of the area. Participants will learn about the cultural significance of the iconic monument and the stories behind the surrounding landmarks.

A cutting-edge technology exhibition showcasing innovations in artificial intelligence, cloud computing, and IoT from leading tech companies. Attendees can explore interactive exhibits, attend keynote speeches, and participate in workshops on emerging tech trends.

Featuring films from around the world, the Hyderabad International Film Festival celebrates the art of cinema. The event includes screenings, panel discussions with filmmakers, and awards for outstanding films in various categories.

A photography contest held in the scenic Botanical Gardens, encouraging nature enthusiasts to capture the beauty of the park’s flora and fauna. Participants will receive professional guidance on photography techniques and can submit their best shots for prizes.

A vibrant crafts fair showcasing traditional handicrafts, textiles, and artwork from artisans across India. Visitors can shop for unique handmade items and enjoy live demonstrations of weaving, pottery, and other traditional crafts.

An art exhibition at Salar Jung Museum, featuring rare paintings, sculptures, and artifacts from its extensive collection. The exhibit highlights the rich artistic heritage of India and includes guided tours for art enthusiasts.

A traditional Bonalu procession featuring vibrant parades, music, and devotional performances. Held in honor of the goddess Mahakali, the event is a key part of Hyderabad’s cultural calendar and attracts devotees from across the region.

A medieval-themed fair set within the ancient walls of Golconda Fort, complete with historical reenactments, traditional games, and local crafts. The event recreates the atmosphere of the fort during the height of its power.

A culinary festival dedicated to Hyderabad’s famous street food, offering delicacies like biryani, kebabs, and Irani chai. Food stalls from different parts of the city come together, allowing visitors to sample a variety of flavors and dishes.

event: Hussain Sagar Lake Boat Ride and Sunset Show
details: A scenic boat ride on Hussain Sagar Lake, followed by a sunset viewing at the lake’s promenade. The event includes live music performances and a special photo session against the backdrop of the Buddha statue.

A historical exhibition at the Qutb Shahi Tombs, showcasing artifacts and documents that detail the dynasty’s rule over the Deccan. Visitors can explore the tombs and learn about the rich architectural and cultural contributions of the Qutb Shahi kings.

Held annually during Makar Sankranti, the kite festival sees the skies of Hyderabad filled with colorful kites. Participants of all ages can compete in kite-flying contests, and there are workshops on traditional kite-making techniques.

A fashion show at Laad Bazaar, featuring the latest bridal trends in jewelry and attire. Local designers and artisans showcase their creations, with a special focus on traditional Hyderabadi bridal wear.

A day of eco-friendly outdoor activities at Durgam Cheruvu Lake, including kayaking, nature walks, and bird watching. The event promotes environmental awareness and encourages participants to reconnect with nature in a sustainable way.

A classical music concert featuring renowned artists performing Carnatic and Hindustani music. The event takes place in an open-air venue, creating a serene atmosphere for music lovers to enjoy traditional Indian music.

A lively night bazaar around Charminar, offering a variety of street food, handicrafts, and local goods. Visitors can shop for souvenirs, enjoy live performances, and experience the vibrant nightlife of Hyderabad.

An annual literary event that brings together authors, poets, and thinkers from across India and beyond. The festival features book readings, panel discussions, and workshops, providing a platform for literary enthusiasts to engage with contemporary literature.
